metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2983 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Drupal 6.x before 6.31 and 7.x before 7.27 does not properly isolate the cached data of different anonymous users, which allows remote anonymous users to obtain sensitive interim form input information in opportunistic situations via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2983` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

drupal7 - 7.27+dfsg2-2
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Daniel F. Kudwien, Rodionov Igor, Ryan Szrama, Roman Zimmermann

notes.Note: seth-arnold> See Drupal's advisory, changes to hosted applications may be necessary

criterions.comment: drupal7 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.27+dfsg2-2').
